content: The "Veterans Treatment Court Improvement Act of 2018" mandates the hiring of 50 Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists by the Department of Veterans Affairs to work in veterans treatment courts or other veteran-focused courts within a year of the Act's enactment. The eligible Department of Veterans Affairs medical centers must comply with guidelines for hiring Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists and work within local criminal justice systems with justice-involved veterans. They should also maintain affiliations with veterans treatment courts and provide specialists to serve on justice teams. The Secretary prioritizes placing Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists at VA medical centers affiliated with veterans treatment courts to support justice-involved veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must report to Congress within one year of the enactment of this Act on the implementation and impact of the Veterans Justice Outreach Program, including the status of hiring Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must report to Congress on the implementation of the Veterans Justice Outreach Program, including the number of Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists hired and assigned to each participating medical center. It should also include information on the eligible medical centers that sought placement of a specialist and how many received no placement. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must report to Congress on the implementation of the Veterans Justice Outreach Program, including the number of Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists hired and assigned to each participating medical center, with details on eligible medical centers seeking placement of a specialist. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must report to Congress on the implementation of the Veterans Justice Outreach Program, including the number of justice-involved veterans served by a Veterans Justice Outreach Specialist and those without access to one. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report to Congress on the implementation and effectiveness of the Veterans Justice Outreach Program, including an assessment of the Secretary's obligations, the number of veterans served by Outreach Specialists, and identification of underutilized services. In this section, the term "justice team" refers to a group of individuals who assist justice-involved veterans in specialized courts. The term "justice-involved veteran" is also defined. The Comptroller General will provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of the Veterans Justice Outreach Program. The term "justice-involved veteran" refers to a veteran with recent contact with the local criminal justice system. The term "local criminal justice system" includes law enforcement, jails, prisons, and courts. The Veterans Justice Outreach Program identifies and provides services to justice-involved veterans, with outreach specialists serving as liaisons between the Department of Veterans Affairs and the local criminal justice system. A veterans treatment court is a State or local court participating in a program for justice-involved veterans.
